page.title: 17CHANGES IN EAST MERSEA
page.content: Several old people were questioned about changes that have occurred in East Mersea. This century the most important developments have been the provision of mains water, mains sewerage and electricity. These replaced wells, earth closets, oil lamps and candles. Cars have replaced horses but East Mersea is still comparatively peaceful. There have been many changes in the landscape. Fields have been enlarged to take modern agricultural machinery ( recently seven fields were made into one ), footpaths have disappeared and the golf course has been replaced by Cudmore Grove Country Park. This has attracted more visitors but the older residents say there is little vandalism and life in the village is still pleasant and quiet.
